votebox.middle.view

Interface IFocusable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDrawable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Button, FocusableLabel, ToggleButton, WriteInToggleButton

    public interface IFocusable
extends IDrawable
    Some IDrawables have additional view-related behavior which stems from the fact that some IDrawables are actually "buttons," or user interface controls. We term these controls "focusable," and make them implement the interface IFocusable. This term stems from the fact that these controls must be able to communicate to the user that he is currently "focused" on them--that if he presses some type of "select" control, that he will chose the item that is "focused." The view can communicate to an IFocusable whether it would like it to be focused or unfocused by invoking the two functions defined here.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void focus()
      Invoke this method to ask this focusable item to "focus" itself.
      IFocusable getDown()
      Call this method to get the focusable that has been defined as being "below" this one.
      IFocusable getLeft()
      Call this method to get the focusable that has been defined as being "to the left" of this one.
      IFocusable getNext()
      Call this method to get the focusable that has been defined as being "after" this one, by some predefined sequence.
      IFocusable getPrevious()
      Call this method to get the focusable that has been defined as being "before" this one, by some predefined sequence.
      IFocusable getRight()
      Call this method to get the focusable that has been defined as being "to the right" of this one.
      IFocusable getUp()
      Call this method to get the focusable that has been defined as being "above" this one.
      void select()
      Invoke this method to tell this focusable item that the user has chosen (or selected) it.
      void setDown(IFocusable focusable)
      Call this method to define which focusable is "below" this one.
      void setLeft(IFocusable focusable)

      Call this method to define which focusable is "next after" this one.

      Call this method to define which focusable is "previous before" this one.

      Call this method to define which focusable is "right of" this one.

      Invoke this method to ask this focusable item to "unfocus" itself.
